definition: the Chinese People's Volunteer Army deployed by China to aid North Korea in 1950
pinyin: Zhong1 guo2 ren2 min2 zhi4 yuan4 jun1

sentences.english: With the chance of Universiade, Shenzhen proposes to build a voluntary city with the effort of all citizens.
sentences.chinese: 借大運會契機，深圳提出全民共建“志願之城”。

sentences.english: Volunteer to coach or assistant coach a kids sports team.
sentences.chinese: 志願去做孩子們的運動隊教練，或是教練助理。

sentences.english: It was the volunteer emergency crew on the other end.
And for that I need a byte of volunteers, alright?
sentences.chinese: 爲此，我需要一個字節的志願者，誰來？

sentences.english: One volunteer, yes come on up what's your name?
sentences.chinese: 一位志願者，好，過來，你叫什麼名字？

sentences.english: This met the volunteer and to play amain role either by the donation or the participation.
sentences.chinese: 本會志願者並且充當了一個主要角色或由捐贈或參加。

sentences.english: Those taking part were volunteers who were offered a limited edition copy of the photo.
sentences.chinese: 參與拍照的志願者可獲贈一份限量版照片。

sentences.english: The fighting unit was composed of volunteers.
sentences.chinese: 那支戰鬥部隊由志願兵組成。

sentences.english: I needed to travel or volunteer or take an unpaid internship.
sentences.chinese: 我需要去旅行，做志願者或者去做無薪實習生。

sentences.english: No laws forbid payment to volunteers.
sentences.chinese: 法律沒有禁止給予志願者報酬。

sentences.english: Ms. Chilton says she hopes more people will volunteer to help children.
sentences.chinese: 奇爾頓表示，她希望更多人志願幫助這些孩子們。

sentences.english: Volunteers were in the bush all the time and didn't let on.
sentences.chinese: 志願軍戰士們一直在灌木叢中，沒有暴露目標。

sentences.english: We also need volunteers, skilled and general.
sentences.chinese: 我們也需要志願者，熟手和普通的。
所以他們找了一羣志願者。

sentences.english: Next, the participants read an article about blood donations.
sentences.chinese: 接下來，志願者們需閱讀關於獻血的文章。

sentences.english: That man is a volunteer fireman in this town.
sentences.chinese: 那個人是鎮裏的志願消防隊員。

definition: to enter a school or college/to go to school for the first time as a child
to enter oneself for an examination
to accept an applicant (prospective student, employee etc) who passes an entrance exam/to admit (a student)/to hire (a job candidate)
specialty/specialized field/main field of study (at university)/major/CL:門|门[men2],個|个[ge4]/professional
to apply (for a job)/to reply to a job advertisement
quota/number of places/place (in an institution, a group etc)
